channel.title: Comments on: Using a palette as line color

item.title: By: Antonio
item.dc:creator: Antonio
item.description: Great! It was really helpful, thanks!

item.title: By: Mohammad
item.dc:creator: Mohammad
item.description: Is it possible to have a line-point style for xy plot in which color of points is different from line. I know it possible to plot xy two times one with line and one with points each use different color, but I don't mean this solution
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to have a line-point style for xy plot in which color of points is different from line. I know it possible to plot xy two times one with line and one with points each use different color, but I don’t mean this solution

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description: Hi Carlo, thanks for your nice words. Don't worry, I'm not very active here at the moment, but the page will be available during the next years.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Carlo,
thanks for your nice words. Don’t worry, I’m not very active here at the moment, but the page will be available during the next years.

item.title: By: Carlo Monjaraz
item.dc:creator: Carlo Monjaraz
item.description: Once again thanks for all your tips! I am seriously thinking in saving all your tips in a PDF manual as back up! :P As an active user of gnuplot I find this website probably my first resource to make the plots look nice. Thanks so much! Carlo
item.content:encoded:
Once again thanks for all your tips!
I am seriously thinking in saving all your tips in a PDF manual as back up! :P As an active user of gnuplot I find this website probably my first resource to make the plots look nice. Thanks so much! Carlo

item.title: By: Sabri
item.dc:creator: Sabri
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

I am new gnuplot, I have a set of single column values, like below,
30.5
20.3
50.5
60.2
75.1
all I want to do is, if the value is 20 yellow and >50 red. How do I do this?

Below are the code that I am using now,
set term pngcairo
set output “***.png”
set style fill transparent solid 0.30 noborder
plot ‘***.dat’ with filledcurves x1 lc rgb “blue”

item.title: By: MAJID
item.dc:creator: MAJID
item.description:
Hi hagen
i want to plot the following file of vectors with the color of the vectors changing according to the position
Thank you in advance!
Regards.
item.content:encoded:
Hi hagen

i want to plot the following file of vectors with the color of the vectors changing according to the position

Thank you in advance!

Regards.

item.title: By: Stefano
item.dc:creator: Stefano
item.description: Hi, Yes, turns out the version was the problem, works fine with 4.6. I'd like to thank you for this website: it's a real lifesaver :)
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
Yes, turns out the version was the problem, works fine with 4.6. I’d like to thank you for this website: it’s a real lifesaver :)

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description:
Hi Stefano.
Please try if you can reproduce Fig. 5 by the gnuplot script and data given in the figure caption. If not then it is most likely a problem due to your gnuplot version.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Stefano.

Please try if you can reproduce Fig. 5 by the gnuplot script and data given in the figure caption. If not then it is most likely a problem due to your gnuplot version.

item.title: By: Stefano
item.dc:creator: Stefano
item.description:
Hello, I was trying to get something along the lines of your Fig. 5 plot, using gnuplot 4.2 (patchlevel 6), but while I do get the correct colors as indicated in my third column when using lines or points, when I try boxes the palette takes the color values from the first column of data (which is instead the height of the boxes).
Any idea what's going on? may it be a version related problem?
Sorry for bothering you.
Stefano
item.content:encoded:
Hello,
I was trying to get something along the lines of your Fig. 5 plot, using gnuplot 4.2 (patchlevel 6), but while I do get the correct colors as indicated in my third column when using lines or points, when I try boxes the palette takes the color values from the first column of data (which is instead the height of the boxes).

Any idea what’s going on? may it be a version related problem?

Sorry for bothering you.

Stefano
